title: How to use groupStatModule
text: soroban‚Äôs groupStatModule performs Aggregation. article, ‚Äôll use scholarship dataset datatoys article based 0.0.1 Version soroban

title: How to use groupStatModule
text: soroban‚Äôs module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let‚Äôs add treeModule ui. also, treeModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_groupStatModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_groupStatModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_groupStatModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_groupStatModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # Run application

title: How to use groupStatModule
text: groupStatModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) Select group summary metric. build

title: How to use groupStatModule
text: Using scholarship, ‚Äôll see summary metric catetory university. Set group ÌïôÏ†úÎ≥Ñ summary mean.  result shows . university category ÎåÄÌïô (university), average scholarship (ÍµêÏô∏Ïû•ÌïôÍ∏à) near 13.9 Billion. university category Ï†ÑÎ¨∏ÎåÄÌïô (college), average scholarship near 6.8 Billion. (almost X2) groupStatModule supports multiple group. ÌïôÏ†úÎ≥Ñ, options can choose. issue suggestion, please make issue soroban‚Äôs github.

title: How to use kmsModule
text: soroban‚Äôs kmsModule generates k-means cluster. article, ‚Äôll use USArrests dataset datasets, can just use data("USArrests") article based 0.0.1 Version soroban

title: How to use kmsModule
text: soroban‚Äôs module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let‚Äôs add treeModule ui. also, treeModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_kmsModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_kmsModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datasets::USArrests)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_kmsModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_kmsModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datasets::USArrests)   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # Run application

title: How to use kmsModule
text: treeModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) select K build Cluster data different scale (normalized), check scale. data label (name), can select Labels-Opt

title: How to use kmsModule
text: Using USArrests, ‚Äôll group city similarity. Set K 4  issue suggestion, please make issue soroban‚Äôs github.

title: How to use mlrModule
text: soroban‚Äôs mlrModule perform Multiple Linear Regression analysis shows linear model & variable importance. article, ‚Äôll use marketing dataset datarium article based 0.0.1 Version soroban datarium::marketing

title: How to use mlrModule
text: soroban‚Äôs module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let‚Äôs add pcaModule ui. also, pcaModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_mlrModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_mlrModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datarium::marketing)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_mlrModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_mlrModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datarium::marketing) # remotes::install_github('kassambara/datarium')   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # Run application

title: How to use mlrModule
text: pcaModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) select explain, response variables Reg (Regression !)

title: How to use mlrModule
text: Using marketing, ‚Äôll see factor makes sales. Select facebook, newspaper, youtube X sales Y  can see variable importance left, (means Youtube effect sales Facebook) model right panel ( \(sales \approx 0.1878 \times facebook + 0.045 \times youtube + 3.505\) ) Note , mlrModule automatically select model AIC (stepwise) newspaper removed process (may small effect sales) issue suggestion, please make issue soroban‚Äôs github.

title: How to use pcaModule
text: soroban‚Äôs pcaModule perform pca analysis generates Biplot. article, ‚Äôll use scholarship dataset datatoys article based 0.0.1 Version soroban

title: How to use pcaModule
text: soroban‚Äôs module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let‚Äôs add pcaModule ui. also, pcaModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_pcaModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_pcaModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_pcaModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_pcaModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(datatoys::scholarship) # remotes::install_github('statgarten/datatoys')   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server) # Run application

title: How to use pcaModule
text: pcaModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) select variable analysis. (data different scale, check normalize) 2-1. (Optional) adjust plot‚Äôs height (consider modify UI version) Draw

title: How to use pcaModule
text: Using scholarship, ‚Äôll see factor makes university differ. However, change data‚Äôs type first. since PCA module requires options types. change ÌïôÏ†úÎ≥Ñ factor. category University College. fill variables like image; mean type scholarship. (sum schoar removed)  (ÎåÄÌïôÎ™Ö means name university, used Label (optional)) result shown.  note university shows like outlier, means provide scholarships student. (like Seoul Univ.)  move / zoom figure (uses plotly can use interactive feature), can see many types scholarship provided forward Red university Blue college. issue suggestion, please make issue soroban‚Äôs github.

title: How to use treeModule
text: soroban‚Äôs treeModule generates Decision tree. article, ‚Äôll use TeachingRatings dataset AER article based 0.0.1 Version soroban

title: How to use treeModule
text: soroban‚Äôs module assumes used Shiny application. can use snippet(type shinyapp) build basic shiny application. application show nothing. let‚Äôs add treeModule ui. also, treeModule server. final (basic) code like . (Assume data AER loaded.) notice 2 things. id ui server . inputData server format reactive
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    }  shinyApp(ui, server) ui <- fluidPage(   mod_treeModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) ) server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_treeModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(TeachingRatings)   ) } library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   mod_treeModule_ui(     id = 'module'   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   mod_treeModule_server(     id = 'module',      inputData = reactive(TeachingRatings)   ) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: How to use treeModule
text: treeModule consisted Control Area Result Area using flow. Declare module (already) select variable generate tree. 2-1. (Optional) adjust tree layout option like Edge Node, Terminal tree build Tree

title: How to use treeModule
text: Using TeachingRatings, ‚Äôll see factor effects teacher‚Äôs evaluation. Set X beauty, minority, age ,gender,division,native,tenure (order important) Y eval. want model Evaluation 7 factors Also, treeModule supports regression . select nodePlot options beauty, gender, minority (typo fixed version)  Tree, generated tree shown.  Result shows , beauty factor‚Äôs effect teacher evaluation. scatter plot regression relation beauty eval based gender. (consider change nodePlot option may required version) However change character type value factor, (accurate) result also changed. issue suggestion, please make issue soroban‚Äôs github.
